text: Stanislaus Josef "Stan" Pilecki (4 February 1947 â€“ 20 December 2017) was an Australian rugby union player. He played 18 times for the national team, the Wallabies, between 1978 and 1984. He also played for the Queensland in 122 games. Pilecki was born in refugee camp in Augustdorf, Germany. His parents were Polish. He grew up in Queensland, Australia. Pilecki died of a short illness on 20 December 2017 at his home in Jindalee, Queensland. He was 70. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Australian rugby union players Category:Disease-related deaths in Queensland Category:Sportspeople from Brisbane
title: Stan Pilecki
